text: just show you the scene live in
Barcelona where they are preparing to
remember the victims of the attacks with
a minute's silence at midday local time
that is 11 o'clock our time you can see
a large crowd gathered there amongst
them the Spanish king and other members
of the government as well so let's just
bring you right up to date with the
latest developments as we have them out
three separate incidents being looked at
by investigators in Spain all linked it
seems on Wednesday a house was
completely destroyed in a large
explosion in Alcona that was around a
hundred miles away from Barcelona at the
time it did not seem to be linked to
anything else but subsequently the
Barcelona attack happening yesterday in
which 13 people were killed in a van
attack was then believed to be linked
potentially to what happened in El canal
because the authorities now believe that
they were planning some sort of devices
in el canal that they think may have
been used or were intended to be used in
Barcelona 13 dead in Barcelona dozens
injured three people arrested after that
attack and separately in Cambria's which
is around 50 or so miles from Barcelona
a coastal town seven people were injured
after a car was driven into them five
men wearing fake suicide belts and armed
were shot dead so we are awaiting the
minute silence in Barcelona in just the
next few minutes
also three days of national mourning has
been declared
